title: Condensing into One Equation
text: We can multiply the second equation by $$-2$$ and add to get $$-13y=65$$.
speech: We can multiply the second equation by  minus, 2  and add to get  negative 13 y is equal to 65 .
pacedSpeech: We can multiply the second equation by   minus, 2
and add to get   negative 13 y is equal to 65

title: Solving the Equation
speech: minus 13 y is equal to 65  simplifies to  y, is equal to negative 5 .
pacedSpeech: simplifies to   y, is equal to negative 5

title: Substituting for the Other Variable
text: Plugging $$y=-5$$ into the second equation, we get that 2x+5(-5)=-31, which means that $$x=-3$$.
speech: Plugging  y is equal to, negative 5  into the second equation, we get that 2x+5(-5)=-31, which means that  x, is equal to negative 3 .
